sub_title: Accounting & Project Manager Benelux at Ecolab Netherlands ( PRINCE2 certified , PMP trained)
summary:
Over 18+ years of well-rounded experience in developing and executing process transitions and stabilization, focusing on the best business practices across regions for Global accounts of F&A. Well versed with Financial Management / Accounting Systems with deftness in implementing systems / procedures to achieve financial discipline and enhance the efficiency of the organization. Have an outstanding record of achievements enabling smooth career growth and surpassing organisational goals. 
Ability to build strong, sustainable relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Transforming high-potential staff into outstanding front-runners critical to financial and operational success.

projects.title: Blackline MJE workflow Implementation
projects.description:
Objectives :

Implement journal entry Blackline solution for all manual journal entries for Europe ( 2 legacy companies ) per GBS scope
All MJE’s require approval 

Key changes:

Manage manual journal entry process through Blackline from preparation of he information to actual posting in the ERP 

8 templates developed in Blackline . 3 general templates ; 3 inter company templates and 2 adjustment templates
Support documentation mandatory for all MJE’s
Approval levels and Domains maintained and controlled at system level 
Risk & Dependencies identified 

UAT & PILOT summary : 
Duration 2 + months , Team involved + 40 GBS associates
License estimation reviewed 

Training summary : 
Global & Regional communication shared 
Session per wave initiated - including introduction session , training session , practice session and Q&A session

Go live : 
Monitor and follow up any entry posted outside of Blackline during pilot and share feedback with project team 
Tracking feedback 
Working on governance - documentation etc

contributors.headline: Accounting & Project Manager Benelux at Ecolab Netherlands ( PRINCE2 certified , PMP trained)

projects.title: Closing Harmonization
projects.description:
Objective: 

Make GBS fully accountable for US GAAP reporting in HFM. Process owners will have E2E responsibility and accountability including issue resolution . Local finance will no longer act as a gate keeper for US GAAP 

Key changes :

One closing framework structured into preclosing , closing and post closing activities :
Revised key milestones 
29 closing calendars consolidated 
Standardised closing steps ( same task for all entities )
Country specific closing steps 
Cut off dates harmonies and changes for some key milestones 
Non closing steps removed from closing calendars 
Redundant closing steps eliminated 
Empowered GBS to manage closing independently ( approval matrix extended , no approval required to continue with closing steps )
Naming conventions in place for the sane closing activity

Roles and Responsibilities defined as per European service delivery model : 

Reduce LF as facilitator 
Direct interaction between GBS, Div Fin and functions
Follow new closing framework 
Transition done to move activities
Internal control adjusted to reflect future ownership and process change 
Continue to report defined KPI’s

contributors.headline: Accounting & Project Manager Benelux at Ecolab Netherlands ( PRINCE2 certified , PMP trained)

projects.title: MJE Threshold
projects.description:
Threshold introduced : 

Preclose - No thresholds except for Prepaids which must exceed USD 10K
WD1 till WD3 - MJE’s > USD 10 K only 
WD4 - MJE’s > USD 100K only 
WD5 - Only MJE’s for Income Taxes will be accepted ( without threshold )

Exceptions : 

Interface payroll postings can be processed inside closing 
All technical and recurring postings managed by GBS

Approach :

Get visibility on volume and value of MJE’s processed in order to initiate a policy changes 
Move MJE outside the closing process whenever possible 
Changes communicated to the teams 
Approval matrix reviewed 
Follow existing org structure  within GBS for escalations 
Reject MJE’s not matching the threshold 
KPI introduced to measure the progress

contributors.headline: Accounting & Project Manager Benelux at Ecolab Netherlands ( PRINCE2 certified , PMP trained)

projects.title: Blackline Implementation for Local Finance Organisation
projects.description:
Lead the project as Co Project manager with Finance process lead at Client side. 

Solution / Approach PMBOK:

No common tool & repository for account reconciliations performed for the legal entities owned by local finance. 43 entities in scope.100% are manually reconciled and administered. Visibility achieved on how accounts are reconciled at all levels. Common reporting to Management on account reconciliations performed. This initiative got added as priority for 2018 to Expand technology and automation capabilities across entities. Implementation of Blackline enabled one central repository for all reconciliations, transparency, real-time visibility on status of account reconciliations, remote audits, eliminate paper-based archival. Implementation of Blackline for accounts owned locally (from 0% to 100%) + training performed through WebEx. IMPLEMENTATION CAPITAL $K: 23 for additional licenses (31 $k planned)

contributors.headline: Accounting & Project Manager Benelux at Ecolab Netherlands ( PRINCE2 certified , PMP trained)

projects.title: Clean up of SOD conflicts (System Roles) for Non SAP country UK
projects.description:
Lead the Clean up and Harmonisation 

Collaborated with all process areas (AP, AR, RTR, CMD, APFRT) in developing mitigation plans on conflict raised during SOD review of UK ERP's. Identified 50 SOD conflicts across process areas, 7 Mitigation Plan prepared and implemented. Steps performed: Harmonization of System Roles for GBS users, Identify and Removal of SOD conflicts. Clean up of in active users from all UK ERP’s ASW, Intellect, Phoenix, and RAM. Revision of current business roles. Split of roles for GBS and Local Finance proposed. Removal of posting rights for local finance. Validate basic BPCM/Global Accounting policy. Implementation of mitigation controls.

contributors.headline: Accounting & Project Manager Benelux at Ecolab Netherlands ( PRINCE2 certified , PMP trained)

projects.title: Transition of UK Record To Report (RTR) activities to Global business Services
projects.description:
Lead the transition as Project lead and Coordinator. 

Solution / Approach DMAIC:

Transition UK, Ireland and Pest RTR transactional activities to GBS. Implemented Blackline for account reconciliations at local and operations side. Documentation of DTPs, Implementation of performance metrics & controls. Governance implemented like MJE Approval matrix, Generic e-mail box, Month end closing, and Escalation matrix. Utilization of CoE’s for sub-processes .Key user in place in GBS to raise/ monitor tickets for UK IT set-up. Local IT in place by business; which drives complexity of each request. Additional support in place from MFD to follow-up on pending tickets on a weekly basis. Critical Access (iSeries for ASW) in UKIE supported by IT in case of an emergency. Period Table Setup (ASW & Intellect) in UKIE PESTUK driven organizationally. Local Finance Posting Analysis in place to ensure MJEs are processed at GBS side only; Any postings made by Local Finance identified and transferred to GBS. Archival process transformation implemented with no hard copies. Soft copies/backups of the posted documents and attachments saved at countries shared drives. Setup of Global SOX and Non SOX Internal Control Framework. Project concluded successfully with completion of all phases on time (Solution identification, Knowledge transfer, Pilot, Stabilization and Control)
 
Business Impact

Moved UK process to Finance Service Delivery Model. Clear separation of transactional activities. Various operational governance in place to support smooth functioning across RTR areas. Process documentation enabling process continuity and back-up. Reduction of risk (corruption, compliance). GBS acts as Single point of contact for auditors. Harmonized KPIs, controls, Defined baseline process matrix. Project nominated as one of the best project of FY2018 being first time right transition.

projects.title: Blackline Implementation for UK Local Finance Organisation
projects.description:
Lead the project as Co Project manager with Finance process lead at Client side. 

Solution / Approach PMBOK:

Blackline Reconciliation implemented for UK for both Genpact and Local Finance + Supply Chain Finance. Structure build for entire Trial balance with HFM mapping for all entities, Roles identified and Set it up in Blackline, Entities created in Blackline environment. Internal Control mapped with accounts, Onsite Training provided to Local And Genpact team. Monthly review of required adjustments in place, Consistent Formalization of sign off across entities for Market finance accounts including SCF. Recognized in Client Finance newsletter for implementing Blackline in first NON-SAP country.

profile_positions.description:
Managing and coordinating the statutory audit cycle with external auditors. Primary point of contact for all daily audit-related issues across PWC NL, PWC Krakow, PWC Bueno Aires, and Ecolab CPA teams and make sure all tasks have been completed accurately and on schedule. This includes maintaining relationships with external auditors.

Liaise on a range of topics, including gathering and preparing supporting materials, responding to connect requests, scheduling weekly meetings with relevant PWC departments, facilitating steering committee calls. Document audit's progress and ensure that the signoff and other compliance criteria were met. Contributed to the audit and successful clearance of backlog for Netherland Audit FY2016 till FY2021 by 83%.

Review balance sheet reconciliations prepared by GBS and Local finance team as per risk assessment defined. Identify large and unusual transactions. Ensure accuracy, adequate support documentation, transparency, and Audit readiness. Timely Closure and maintenance of balance sheet open items.

Maintain statutory financial statement layout in SAP for Belgium and Netherlands operating entities to facilitate the bridge file. Maintain guidelines on alternative accounts mapping and structure per Belgian local regulations.

Collaborate with centralised accounting and business services to promote process improvement.

Review and support annual statutory accounts in accordance with the IFRS and Dutch GAAP.

Preparation of Workers Council packages and Financials statement in Kluwer Software for Belgian operating
entities including BOD, management report and SHR

Drive transformation relating to organisational initiatives, standardisation, and quality improvements.Has accountability for overall project including project plan, scope, process design and solution, delivery to the project plan and budget. Ensure documentation for the project and related processes. Accountability for support, implementation, and hyper care of projects.
profile_positions.title: Accounting and Project Manager Benelux

profile_positions.description:
Provide leadership to finance professionals team of 25 members for Global business services (serving 14 european countries).Centrally managing period control table for all process areas GL/FA/IC/AP/AR/SALES.

Other Key deliverables:

•	Stakeholder Management: Conduct periodic discussions with stakeholders summarizing team activities and statistics on driving business success.Managing key global stakeholders to ensure reporting requirements and SLAs i.e. quality and timeliness of output are effectively met.
•	Business Development and Strategic Expansion: Act as a primary contact for business development and generating volumes. Identify team’s strategic expansion opportunities and engage in process transition, process flow mapping, resource requirements and SLAs negotiation and delivery.
•	Business Strategy and Project Management: Engage with key regional and shared service stakeholders to understand and contribute in the key strategic financial projects
•	Service Delivery/Operations Management: Ensuring successful review of process controls and driving service through efficient workflow and resource management.Liaise with stakeholders to obtain feedback on support levels and quality of output and build improvements into the deliverables.
•	Process Reengineering and Delivering Efficiency Gains: Deliver efficiency gains through process reengineering and drive quality DNA through performance improvement initiatives like Lean/Six-sigma/Green belt
•	Control and Process Audits: Conduct Internal and external periodic operations control audits. Ensure adherence to and compliance with governance, risk policies, procedures and compliance policies and reviews including SLA and KPI's
•	People Management and Engagement: Managing a team of experienced professionals and maintain high motivation and commitment levels. Undertake activities like performance objectives setting, performance appraisals, recruitment, career progression, training needs identification and engagement.
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager

profile_positions.description:
Key deliverables :

•	Lead 3 GAFA teams(Belgium, Netherlands & Germany) for one of the European client
•	Stakeholder Management: Managing key global stakeholders to ensure reporting requirements and SLAs are effectively met.
•	Maintaining CMP as per compliance, PL review ,KPI’s, Internal Controls , Archival status. Support Internal /external Audit, Period open/close control during month end
•	Keep control over routine accounting work which includes maintenance of proper books of account. Supervision of day to day Accounting activity, Compliance of Company procedures. Timely follow up of Bank/Reconciliations open items & doing regular meeting with controllers to resolve them
•	Quarterly balance sheet review with VP Shared Services on Open and closed items plus opportunity areas  
•	Prepare a Fixed assets movement schedule with reconciliation between opening bal and prior month including movement of additions & disposals. Forecasting/Budgeting of Depreciation bases the Existing and New Assets for Supply chain unit
•	Conducting Variance Analysis of BU’s performance in terms of Budgeted v/s Actuals, Projected v/s Actuals
•	To provide quality briefing which outlines risks to senior management and to liaise with specialist support units
•	Participating in strategic discussion with senior management  with particular emphasis on risk entailed and profitability levers
•	Responsible to review reconciliations for all Balance Sheet accounts and ensure any variance is substantiated with proper explanation and open item duly closed
•	Analyze current and past trends in key performance indicators including all areas of revenue, cost of sales, expenses and capital expenditures
•	Visited Belgium and supported client in 2 week PWC audit for FY2013
•	Certified Green Belt project on ‘Reorganization of GL Team structure” from country based approach to Activity based teams. Achieving standardization and harmonization across 14 countries and Reducing billing of 2 FTE's
profile_positions.title: Manager - Lead 3 largest Finance teams for General Accounting of Global CPG Client.

profile_positions.description:
Key deliverables:

• Intrastat and VAT reporting for Belgium as per European laws, which includes conducting an extensive audit for all the tax codes/Percentages used in purchases and suggest for re-classes and rectifications
•	Independently handling of Fixed Assets area which includes Addition/Retirement/Depreciation/ Capex reporting/ Transfers and Reporting, which includes Audit queries and forecasting/Budgeting of Depreciation bases the Existing and New Assets for Supply chain unit
•	Month end Closing (Responsible for the closer of 8 entities Tollco /sellco/Servco), Bank maintenance. Timely closure of AP/AR/GA, Intercompany books and HFM upload
•	Preparing Balance Sheet Supplementary schedules used for reporting purposes having the details of Acquisitions, Depreciation, Retirements for Fixed Assets, Headcount of the organization, ageing of receivables ,Bad debt allowance etc
•	Responsible for preparing/Review of 19 category of Reconciliations for all Balance Sheet accounts as Accruals, Prepaid, VAT, SL-GL, Bank ,Fixed Asset,Mis Asset /Liabilities etc and ensure any variance is substantiated with proper explanation and open item duly closed

Achievements:
•	Completed 3 leans in 2012 and Filled 6 Lean projects to achieve time saving and accuracy in 2013
•	Received back to back T20 ratings for FY 2012
profile_positions.title: Assistant Manager - Transitioned for General Accounting and Fixed Assets (Belgium)

profile_positions.description:
Key deliverables:

•	Lead the commercial Finance team for Global F&B giant
•	Month end accounting for Costs, Accruals ,WBS Soft closes, prepayments ledger scrutiny and WBS Settlement
•	Updating cost centers report and load indirect forecasting on monthly basis
•	Tracking of controllable expenses and highlighting the pain areas to the business

•	Conducting Variance Analysis of Budgets & Projections v/s Actual

•	Monthly Balance Sheet review, trend analysis, affecting any reclasses and adjustments wherever required

•	Inter Company Accounting ,Balance Sheet & Holos forecasting Recon
•	WBS & Cost centre maintenance, Pricing condition and VAT maintenance

Achievements:

•	Filed a total of 7 lean ideas bring a saving of 233 hours p.a 
•	Actively participated in the Value Stream Mapping process
•	Received ‘Innovator of the quarter’ cash award during the Lean surge contest

•	Supported Customer in extensive SAP Testing  &  implementing new SAP version in 2011

profile_positions.description:

profile_positions.title: Associate

profile_positions.description:
Worked in Finance Division in Tax Management Consultancy, under Dr. V.K. Singhania 

Key Responsibilities in Tax Management Consultancy:

•	Maintaining client’s accounts by providing them with audit information support
•	Maintaining ledgers and day to day accounting
•	Tax accounting support by preparing for quarterly tax provisions and reconciliation of accounts
•	Calculating tax liability, ensuring compliance is completed speedily and efficiently, and submitting tax returns and associated documents by the appropriate deadlines
•	Preparing accounts, budgets, reports and financial statements for clients
•	Auditing internal and external accounts and making end of year calculations
•	Undertaking administrative tasks such as administering payroll and arranging payments for invoices
•	Ensuring the organization’s compliance with current taxation legislation
•	Monitoring company/department financial transactions and controlling budgets
